cellularAutomata.movie
Class MovieMaker

java.lang.Object
  cellularAutomata.movie.MovieMaker

public class MovieMaker
extends java.lang.Object

Convenience methods for making a movie from images generated by the CA Explorer. With this class, only one movie can be made at a time. A facade for the QuickTimeOutputStream.

Author:
David Bahr

Constructor Detail

Method Detail

closeMovie

public static void closeMovie()
Closes the movie (output stream) when done creating the movie.

isOpen

public static boolean isOpen()
Finds out if movie making is in progress (open), or if it is done (closed). With this class, only one movie can be created at a time.

makeMovieWithDefaultFrameRate

public static void makeMovieWithDefaultFrameRate(java.io.File file)
                                          throws java.io.IOException
A convenience method for creating a Quicktime movie. After creating the movie with this method, add the movie one frame at a time by calling writeFrame(img) where img is a BufferedImage. This method uses a default frame rate of 30fps.

Parameters:
file - The output file name.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If could not create the specified output file.

makeMovie

public static void makeMovie(java.io.File file)
                      throws java.io.IOException
A convenience method for creating a Quicktime movie. After creating the movie with this method, add the movie one frame at a time by calling writeFrame(img) where img is a BufferedImage. This method pops up a window that asks the user for the frame rate.

Parameters:
file - The output file name.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If could not create the specified output file.

makeMovie

public static void makeMovie(java.io.File file,
                             int frameRate)
                      throws java.io.IOException
A convenience method for creating a Quicktime movie. After creating the movie with this method, add the movie one frame at a time by calling writeFrame(img) where img is a BufferedImage.

Parameters:
file - The output file name.
frameRate - The number of frames per second (30 or 60 are good defaults).
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If could not create the specified output file.

writeFrame

public static void writeFrame(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
Writes an image as a frame on the movie.

Parameters:
image - The image that will become a frame of the movie.
